metadata.dc:author: Pardo Mindán, F J
Valérdiz Casasola, S
metadata.dc:description: Four cases of primary signet-ring cell adenocarcinoma of the urinary bladder are described. All patients were men, with ages ranging from 46 to 81 years. The number of signet-ring cells varied and showed a direct correlation with poor prognosis. PAP analyses of acid phosphatase and prostate-specific antigen were negative. The results show that signet-ring cell carcinoma has a poor prognosis. This cell type should be sought in all bladder carcinomas since its presence is likely to worsen prognosis.
metadata.dc:title: Carcinoma de células en anillo de sello de la vejiga urinaria: estudio de cuatro casos y revisión de la literatura.
[Signet-ring cell carcinoma of the urinary bladder: study of 4 cases and review of the literature].
